formattedAddress: 464 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA
adrFormatAddress: 464 Amsterdam Ave, New York, NY 10024, USA

originalText.text:
We were lucky to be with a large group of our friends and so we got to try a variety of the food here. It did not disappoint! I came back from Milan recently and the Italian food here is just as amazing. I think my favorite with the eggplant pizza and the squid ink pasta, so hard to choose. The drinks were delicious and presentation is 10/10! Our food came out relatively quick and our waiters constantly swapped our plates and utensils with clean ones with each course. The desserts were so good I ended up combining them with each bite!

This is definitely a perfect place for date night as the decor is posh and modern. I love how each location is consistent and so whatever we couldn‚Äôt try we will at the Rutherford location we normally order at. I highly recommend trying Song‚ÄôE Napule if you haven‚Äôt!

originalText.text: We had a wonderful early meal at Song E Napule last night. We were seated at a true three-top banquet in the front, right against the window. Our server (Catal√≠n?) was attentive without having to hover, supported by a small staff of great back-waiters and food runners. Our burrata with prosciutto appetizer was eye-openingly memorable. And both pizzas Diavola and Salsicce e Friarielli were divine. The beers were an Italian brewery that I didn‚Äôt know, but could have been better if they weren‚Äôt oxidized. We highly, highly recommend the Delizia Al Limon for dessert- a perfect light, and fresh tasting finish. Thank you so much for the hospitality, we can‚Äôt wait to come back!

originalText.text: Excellent and authentic Neapolitan restaurant. Pizzas made of imported ingredients cooked in an imported brick oven. Reminded me of pizza in Southern Italy, thin, soft, moist and delicious. Even our waitress, Carmela, was imported from Naples. Fabulous service and food.

text.text: Excellent and authentic Neapolitan restaurant. Pizzas made of imported ingredients cooked in an imported brick oven. Reminded me of pizza in Southern Italy, thin, soft, moist and delicious. Even our waitress, Carmela, was imported from Naples. Fabulous service and food.

originalText.text: Went with Italian friends who swear by this place. Truly one of the best Italians I have had. Burrata was to die for. Veal pasta was also one of a kind and incredibly flavorful. Panna cotta tasted a bit minty which was weird. Would still recommend.

text.text: Went with Italian friends who swear by this place. Truly one of the best Italians I have had. Burrata was to die for. Veal pasta was also one of a kind and incredibly flavorful. Panna cotta tasted a bit minty which was weird. Would still recommend.
